games.matchupSummary: GT hosts Colorado in a marquee non-conference opener. The Buffaloes bring big-name recruiting but GT's home-field advantage and Brent Key's disciplined defense should keep this close. Key matchup: Justice Haynes vs Colorado's front seven.

Tennessee rolls in as a top-15 program. GT's Evan Haynes and Malachi Hosley will be tested against Vol receivers in what projects as GT's toughest home test. An upset would send massive shockwaves through the ACC.
FCS tuneup against in-state Mercer. Expect heavy rotation and a big debut for younger contributors. OC George Godsey will use this game to expand the playbook.

A cross-country trip to Palo Alto. Stanford is rebuilding and GT arrives with momentum. Noah Carter anchors the LB corps against Stanford's pro-style run game. A toss-up on a neutral academic-rivalry vibe.
ACC opener after the bye. Duke has improved but GT's home record under Brent Key makes this a favorable matchup. Jordan Allen should feast against Duke's secondary.
Lane Stadium is one of the toughest road environments in the ACC. GT will need Malachi Carney and the OL to control the line of scrimmage. A road win here would be huge for division standings.
BC comes to Atlanta as a mid-pack ACC team. GT's Justice Haynes should dominate with room to run. The Jackets' defense, led by the Haynes-Hosley DB duo, should contain BC's passing attack.
Halloween road game in Pittsburgh. Pitt consistently fields tough defenses that will challenge GT's OL. Ethan MacKenny and Malachi Carney must win their individual battles for GT to move the ball.

Mid-November home game with bowl implications likely on the line. Louisville brings a balanced offense but GT's home crowd and defensive depth under Brent Key sets up well. George Godsey's creative play-calling should open things up.

Death Valley is historically brutal for visitors. Clemson remains an ACC powerhouse and GT's toughest conference opponent. An upset here would be program-defining. GT's DBs Haynes and Hosley have the talent to make plays.

Senior Day / rivalry warm-up. Wake Forest has struggled in recent years and GT should handle business at home. A strong offensive showing from Jordan Allen and Justice Haynes would be a great send-off before the rivalry game.

Clean, Old-Fashioned Hate â€” the century-old rivalry finale in Athens. Georgia is typically a top-10 program but GT has shown it can compete. Every point GT scores is celebrated loudly. Brent Key treats this as a bowl game.
